column4: I installed ubuntu 9.10 on a seperate HD on a partition I created, my computer boots to my XP and now I don't see the drive ubuntu installed on. any help?
it wil be partitioned with ext, which isnt readily readable by windows
I had two partitons on this disk, one NTFS and one was formatted EXT4 when I installed ubuntu
yeag windows cant read ext.
but the whole drive? and do you think ubuntu can't see my xp OS becuase it's on a raid?
window cant see the whole drive, same on my pc, but ubuntu can read ntfs
ta
so tell me what doesnt matter etc?
cos windows cant read the drive, nor can its boot loadr, grub works with both windows AND linux so use that
you have to install it (if you install ubuntu last it works by itself)
does grub show the ubuntu set up?
well reinstall ubuntu, im not sure about how the raid will effect hting
yeah, ubtunu does use drive letters
you can tell ubuntu how you want it partitioned, you can make as many partitions as physically possible
during the install
thats fine
? virtual memory? you mean swap? cos that formats as swap , neither ext or ntfs nor fat
yeah swap will get formatted as swap so it didnt matter
yes, remember windows will also see the ntfs partition
LOL edfinatly not
yeah google it an come back again:D
good luck
